Transcript: Lizzie: Jonathan, slow down! Pregnant chick waddling here.
Jonathan: The movie starts in like two minutes.
Lizzie: Okay.

Jonathan: Oh... um, I'm sorry. It’s... it's my bad. I just want to make sure 
that we can sit in the back row together.
Lizzie: Oh. Well, that's okay. I love it when you apologize.
Jonathan: Mm-hmm. We have company, Alan’s watchdog shrink.
Lizzie: Dr. Baker? Where?
Jonathan: Uh-huh, over by the news stand. Don't look! Just play it cool.

Lizzie: Okay. Well, why do that when we can give him a show? Come here, 
sweetie. Did you see the look on that guy's face? It was priceless. ( Laughs ) ( 
movie music playing ) ( sighs ) Oh, I'm so excited you wanted to see this with 
me. I've been dying to see this for weeks.
Jonathan: Okay, um, I'll catch you after the show.
Lizzie: What? Why? Where are you going?
Jonathan: I got a hot date in a dark room with a beautiful blond.
Lizzie: Tammy's here?

Jonathan: We can't be seen in public together because Alan’s goon's following 
us, so, thanks to Mel’s court order, he can't be in the same room as us. So if 
Tammy happens to be in the same place as I am at the same time... you know? I'll 
catch you later. Excuse me. Is that seat taken?

Ashlee: Lizzie! Hi. How lucky is this? I hate watching movies alone. So is 
your better half here?

Jonathan: You okay? Look, I'm sorry that I didn't come by last night. I 
didn't know they were going to put a security camera in your hallway right in 
front of your room.
Tammy: Shh. I'm trying to watch a movie here.
Cassie: ( Sighs )

Josh: And then think about this from time to time. Just think about the fact 
that at this time tomorrow I will be a free man, okay? ( Phone ringing )

Cassie: Marah? Hi, Marah. How are you? What a surprise. I'm fine. I'm just a 
little busy at the... uh-huh. Okay, what exactly do you want to know about your 
folks?
Reva: Hi.
Billy: What's that, an early letter to Santa?

Reva: Actually, that's not a bad idea. No, it's a letter I'm writing to 
Marah. A letter instead of an e-mail. Does that date me?

Billy: No. Not at all. Actually, here's some water. I'd like you to take your 
rest now.
Reva: You know something? I will be able to get plenty of rest once I...
Billy: Yeah, okay.
Reva: ...Well, you know.
Billy: Pills?
Reva: Yes, doctor, yes.
Billy: Um, Reva, you know... what we were talking about yesterday?
Reva: What? You want to take it all back?

Billy: No, no, I... no. Do you know how special you are? I mean, you really 
deserve something very special, and I just want you to know that the way I feel 
about you, I can make it very special for you.
Reva: I know. Billy?
Billy: Mm?
Reva: Everybody needs someone like you. And that's why Josh needs Cassie.
Billy: Okay. Is this your last big project, getting them together?

Reva: Yeah, the best and most painful thing I've ever had to do. Only God 
knows how long I'm going to have to get that job done. ( Knock on door )
Billy: Hey.
Josh: I assume Reva’s here.
Reva: Hey, Joshua.
Billy: Yeah, Josh, this is not really a great time.

Josh: Yeah, well, it never is a good time to sign divorce papers, I guess, is 
it?
Ashlee: Is that Tammy and Jonathan?
Lizzie: Shh.
Ashlee: It is, and they're totally making out.
Lizzie: I'm trying to watch the movie.

Ashlee: Look, that is your husband down there, and he has his hand and his 
tongue all...
Lizzie: He is consoling Tammy. That's it.
Ashlee: Consoling her? About what?
Lizzie: Losing him to me. They used to be engaged.
Ashlee: Yeah. It looks like a really messy breakup.
Lizzie: Well, I'm the one wearing the ring, aren't I?
Ashlee: Jonathan only married you for the sake of the baby.
Lizzie: That's not true.

Ashlee: Oh, come on. We're up here chatting it up, and they're down there 
playing tonsil hockey, and I can't even see his hands.
Lizzie: Will you just stop talking?

Ashlee: What do you think will happen once the baby is born, Lizzie? Don't 
you think Jonathan might ditch you and go back to Tammy?
Lizzie: Ashlee, shut up!
Movie patrons: Shh.
Reva: Billy?
Billy: Yeah. If you need me, I'm close by.
Reva: I had no idea you were working on this.

Josh: I wasn’t. Actually you were the one that gave me the idea that it was 
time. You said... you said it's a good thing to move on, you know, that it's a 
healthy thing to do, that a person should know when it's time to let go and all 
that, so I... I figured it was time to make it official. The legalese was still 
in place from our near miss a couple months ago. Really all that's needed is for 
us to sign.
Reva: We tore up papers like that not too long ago.

Josh: Yeah, but the time that we spent together on top of the lighthouse sort 
of seems like a dream now.
Reva: Yeah.

Josh: But it wasn’t. It was real. And so are these. I think it's just time, 
you know, to let go of all the questions because there really aren't going to be 
any answers, at least none that make sense so everything has been reduced to 
black and white with a little bit of space left at the bottom for us to sign. My 
signature is already there.
Reva: Joshua, I…
Josh: Reva, you’ve already moved on. You have a new address with Billy.

Reva: Yeah, it was right for you to have those papers drawn up again, because 
it will be easier for everyone concerned once we are clearly and legally…

Josh: Divorced. The word is divorced. No more ambiguity, no more wondering 
what to say to friends when they ask. And I guess it’ll be easier to tell the 
kids once the paperwork is signed, so.
Reva: Tell the kids?

Josh: Yes, I mean we have to let them know that it’s permanent, right? I’ll 
let you tell them about you and uncle Billy.

Reva: Oh goody. And you can tell them about you and aunt Cassie. It is 
certainly a lot for them to take in.
Josh: That’s life, I guess.
Reva: Yeah. That’s life.

Josh: I’m sure the kids will understand in time. We had something once, and 
we don't anymore. It's that simple.
Reva: Well, I wouldn't put it that way.

Josh: Well, ultimately I don't know that it matters how we put it. Done is 
done. So I'm going to leave these here for you to sign, and I'll come back later 
to pick them up. You might want to think about calling your lawyer. We just have 
to make sure that nothing financial has changed, and that will be that. I'll see 
you.
Reva: Bye, Joshua.
Mel: Cassie, hi.
Cassie: Hey.
Mel: Are you okay?

Cassie: Your mother’s a shrink. Ask her how to tell her favorite niece that 
her parents are getting divorced again and they just haven’t gotten around to 
telling her about it.
Mel: Did you?

Cassie: Me? Tell Marah, no, I mean I wanted to. I hate to keep something so 
important from her, but I just don't think it's really my place.
Mel: Well, maybe not, but you are involved.

Cassie: Is that your polite way of saying that I'm why the situation is so 
messy?
Mel: Cassie, relax. I'm not judging you.
Cassie: Hey, sorry. I'm just a little defensive on the subject these days.

Mel: Please, whatever you have between you and Josh is none of my business. I 
got my own problems.
Cassie: Really? Anything you care to share?

Mel: Maybe later. So speaking of you and Josh. Where is it that you guys 
stand? Just curious.
Cassie: Yeah, you and me both.
Mel: What do you mean?

Cassie: I haven’t the faintest idea how this is all going to go. I just know 
that when I’m with him, it feels right and simple and I absolutely can see a 
future together.
Mel: And when you’re not with him?

Cassie: I feel like I’m on the Titanic about five minutes after the ice burg 
hit. I just hav e to have faith that my life is gonna turn out ok.
Mel: I hear that.
Beth: I’m a little early, but I couldn’t wait.
Rick: Me either.
Beth: So how did your dinner go with Mel last night?
Rick: It was civil.

Beth: I figured it probably didn't go that well or you wouldn’t have wanted 
to meet me here.
Rick: Probably not.

Beth: Rick, I know that you say that we shouldn't do this, that it's wrong. 
But I also know that you can't stop, can you? And neither can I.
Tammy: Turn around.
Jonathan: I don't believe this. Ashlee.
Tammy: Maybe they didn't see us.
Jonathan: Please, the chick's got radar when it comes to me.
Lizzie: If you're going to sit here, just be quiet and watch the movie, okay?

Ashlee: Look, all I was saying is that maybe you should work a little harder 
to keep your husband.

Lizzie: Jonathan and I are married. Married. And I'm having his baby, so let 
me ask you a question: How thrilled do you think that makes Tammy?
Ashlee: Not very.

Lizzie: It's got to hurt her like crazy. And I bet in the end it kills her 
feelings for Jonathan better than anything I can do.

Jonathan: Look, I know this isn't exactly working out the way we wanted it 
to, but at least we're still together, right?
( Beth giggling ) ( knock on door )
Rick: Who is it?
Waiter: Room service.
Rick: I didn't order anything. Did you order something?

Beth: No. Rick, relax, relax. They probably just have the wrong room. I will 
tell them they made a mistake.

Rick: No, no, Beth, Beth, that’s... it’s... the room's in my name. Let me 
take care of it.
Beth: See? There is nothing to worry about. ( Camera shutter clicking )
( cell phone rings )
Cassie: It's Josh. Hi.
Josh: Hi. It's nice to hear your voice.

Cassie: Same here. So the last time we talked you said that you would be a 
free man today.

Josh: Well, I'm working on it actually. I just dropped off the divorce papers 
with Reva.

Cassie: Well, I mean, I know you said you would, but somehow it actually 
really happening seems so...

Josh: Cassie, my marriage to Reva is over, okay? So the next time I see you, 
which I hope will be soon, I will be an available bachelor.
Cassie: Well, wouldn't that be novel?
Josh: Yeah. So the thing is when this is all done, I want to see you.
Cassie: I might be open to that.

Josh: Great. I was thinking maybe Main Street. It was the site of our first 
semi-official date thing. What do you say?
Cassie: I say yes.
Billy: Did you sign them yet?
Reva: Not yet.
Billy: Reva, I know how hard this must be for you.

Reva: I don't know why it should be hard. I've had plenty of experience 
divorcing the man.

Billy: Yeah, well, but, I mean, it's not quite the same. I mean you're not 
ready this time. You're just pretending.
Reva: I'm not pretending that I want him to be happy.
Billy: Well, maybe a little bit.

Reva: Just because I'm pissed at Josh and Cassie doesn't mean that I don't 
love them.
Billy: Just because you love them doesn't mean you're pissed at them.

Reva: I love that you get me. So you think they'll get together once the 
divorce goes through?
Billy: I think there's a good chance. It's what you want, isn't it?

Reva: I want good things for them. I want them to be there for each other 
when I can't be... damn it, this isn't how I wanted this to go. Hand me the pen.
Billy: Reva, Reva...
Reva: Hand me the pen!
Billy: Okay.

Reva: You know, because Josh would never get on with his life while he was 
still married to me. He wouldn't let himself, and by agreeing to this divorce 
then... then I'm setting him free, you know? Oh, my God.
Billy: "Oh, my God" what?
Reva: This.
Billy: Well, that's just a financial disclosure.
Reva: Yeah, it means that...
Billy: No, it... what... all it's saying is...
Reva: Josh mentioned this to me, but I wasn't listening.
Billy: Darling, darling, it just means that is you have to...

Reva: Billy, it means that I'm going to have to open up my financial records 
to his attorney, and there's going to be this huge gaping hole with all the 
money I spent for my cancer treatments.
Billy: Even if he knows...

Reva: Surgery, radiation, chemo, all that time I spent in the clinic, he's 
going to know that I wasn't using insurance, that I... do you know how much that 
cost?
Billy: No, but I can guess.

Reva: You don't think this wouldn't grab Josh's attention? He's going to know 
something was up. He's going to figure out what it is, where the money went.
Billy: Darling, you've got to take it easy.
Reva: Take it easy?
Billy: Yes.

Reva: Billy? Take it easy? The whole idea was to spare Joshua from having to 
know that I was sick, Billy, and now with this clause in here I might as well 
paint "I'm dying of cancer" right across my forehead. I can't sign this.
Crystal Chappell, "Inside The Light."

Olivia is this lovely mess of a person. She's not so different than most 
people. She has a void in her, and she's searching for something to fill it. It 
just happens to be all the wrong things.
See Olivia Wednesday September 20, "Inside The Light."

Jonathan: Hey, Ashlee. How are you doing? Hey babe. I'm sorry about the Tammy 
thing. I just tried to cheer her up a little bit, but it didn't work too good. 
She's still really hurt. So are you ready to roll?
Lizzie: Yes, I am... ( laughs ) ....
Jonathan: Honey.
Lizzie: Excuse me.
Ashlee: Sorry.

Jonathan: Bye. I think I liked the movie but I wasn't really paying 
attention, you know? Alan's boy, 10:00. Oh! I hope you're not mad at me.
Lizzie: Why would I be mad?

Jonathan: Well, from macking on you during the movie and watching you look up 
at that big screen. I just couldn't keep my hands off of you.
Lizzie: I'm definitely not mad.
Ashlee: It's pretty amazing how Jonathan can go from one woman to the next.
Tammy: See ya, Ashlee.

Ashlee: Wait, I'm sorry. I... I really shouldn't have said that. Listen, if 
it makes you feel any better, Jonathan broke my heart, too. But you get over it. 
Eventually.
Tammy: Yeah, that makes me feel great.
Jonathan: You know what, babe?
Lizzie: What?
Jonathan: The bigger that belly gets, the sexier you are.
Lizzie: Oh!
Jonathan: Who would have thought I'd be so into baby belly?

Lizzie: Ooh, then I wish I was having twins. Come on, honey, let's go home. 
It's nice and quiet and we can be alone.
Jonathan: Okay.
Lizzie: Uh-huh.

Beth: Okay. Let's think this through. You actually think that someone would 
set us up to take a picture of us.
Rick: Us, together, half- naked, yes.
Beth: Why?
Rick: Why? Have you been to Springfieldburns.com lately, Beth? I have.

Beth: Let's not go there, okay? If someone did set us up, it's probably about 
blackmail.
Rick: That makes me feel a lot better. Thank you for making me feel better.
Beth: I will handle it just like I've handled Jonathan before.
Rick: Jonathan? What are you taking about?
Beth: Nothing, nothing. It’s... it’s...
Rick: Does Jonathan know about this, Beth? Does he know about it?
Rick: What does he know, Beth? Does he have proof? Does he have proof?

Beth: It's those damn cell phones that take photos. You know, everyone's a 
paparazzo now.

Rick: What does he want? Beth, what does he want? Does he want money? What 
does he want?

Beth: He wants help. He wants help, and... he wanted me to get Alan off he 
and Lizzie’s back or he was going to publish the photo, but we came to an 
agreement and he said that he would never let it be seen.
Rick: Oh!
Beth: He promised.

Rick: Oh, that's great! A promise from Jonathan Randall, and you believe 
that?
Beth: Yes! Yes, I do. But wait... wait... wait. Where are you going?

Rick: I'm going to tell Mel myself before she's handed some manila envelope 
or she sees it on some web site.
Beth: No, no, no, Rick. No, you cannot do that.
Rick: Beth, this is not negotiable, do you understand? It's nonnegotiable.
Beth: If you tell Mel, she'll tell others-- others meaning Alan.

Rick: I will help you with that. Listen to me. I am going to tell my wife 
myself. She deserves at least that.
Beth: No, Rick... Rick... Rick!

Cassie: See, all I have to do is hear Josh's voice and I am immediately back 
into anything's possible mode.
Mel: Well, there is something to be said about a positive attitude. Come on.
Cassie: Well, it beats being hopeless.
Mel: That's right.

Cassie: I don't know. I just think maybe I should take it slower or call him 
back and tell him I can't go down to Main Street and meet him today.
Mel: You could do that or you could just go. ( Laughter ) Leah, honey, hey.
Leah: Hi, Mom.
Mel: You okay? Is everything good? Hi, baby.
Leah: So how was dinner with daddy last night?
Mel: It was fine.
Leah: Only fine?
Mel: Here, sit down.
Cassie: Hi, Leah. ( Laughs )
Leah: It's funny, I was just thinking about you.
Cassie: Really?

Leah: Yeah, my dad came home from running the other day, and when he gave me 
a hug, I could feel his heart beating. It was so strong and steady, my mind just 
jumped to Richard and the sacrifice he made for dad.
Mel: Honey, Cassie might not want to talk about that.
Cassie: No, no, it's okay. I actually like to hear it.

Leah: It's just if dad hadn't got than transplant, I would never have been 
born, and this probably sounds a bit corny, but what happened back then was all 
about the power of love and what it does for people. I mean, hey, it brought me 
into this world.

Mel: Well, I mean there isn't a day that goes by that I don't thank heaven 
and Richard for sparing Rick’s life.
Cassie: I think we all feel that way.
Leah: I need a soda. Leah, girl, that was really good.
Billy: Was that the bank?

Reva: Yeah. Yeah, it was, and I was right. I can't move any money out of any 
of the joint accounts, not a nickel, without Josh's lawyer seeing it.
Billy: What are you going to do?
Reva: I don't have an idea.

Billy: I do. I will take the money out of my bank, I will get it in cash, I 
will give it to you, and you'll pop it into the bank, and bingo!
Reva: No, that won't work.
Billy: Why not?

Reva: Because, Billy, I'm not going to take your money. Besides, you don't 
have that kind of money lying around.
Billy:, Well, maybe not, but I could sell a little stock. That will be easy.
Reva: Oh, and you don't think Josh will notice that little transaction?
Billy: Okay, then I repeat: What are you going to do?

Reva: I don't know, but I've got to figure out a way to make this thing work, 
but it's just going to take some time.

Billy: Wait a minute. Weren't you the one who just said you didn't exactly 
know how much time you were going to have?
Reva: Thanks for the water.
Billy: Okay. ( Knock on door ) Yep.
Josh: Hi. I came by to pick up the papers. You signed them, right?
Reva: Actually, I haven't signed them yet.
Josh: Okay, what's the problem? I mean, you know what's in them, right?

Reva: Well, yeah, I mean it's just that there's a couple of things in there 
that are complicated that I need to get straightened out before I actually sign. 
I mean, it's okay. I mean, the divorce is still going to go through and all.
Josh: Actually that changes some things for me, though, Reva, so...

Reva: No, Joshua, because what's in these papers is really just about money 
and property and laws. I mean, we both know what decision has been made already 
in our hearts.

Josh: Okay, all right, I'm trying to understand this. I mean, first you were 
talking about setting each other free and you were all gung-ho about starting 
the next phases of our life and now... now, what? There's details to be 
straightened out?
Reva: I'm not trying to stall if that's what you're thinking.

Josh: No, no, no, no. I mean, what happened to the idea of making things 
simple and doing it quickly so we could tell the kids and tell the family and 
move on with our lives? I...
Reva: It’s...
Josh: Complicated? Yeah, I know, things usually are with you, Reva.
Reva: That's not fair.
Josh: I'm just stating a fact, all right?
Billy: Just take it easy.
Josh: You stay the hell out of this!

Reva: Wait a minute. Wait! Both of you getting angry about this is only going 
to make it uglier than it already is, and I don't think either one of us wants 
that.

Josh: Well, what is it that you do want, Reva? I've asked you that question a 
million times.
Reva: I'll call you soon. I promise.
Josh: Yeah, okay. Well, hey, this has been fun. Thank you.

Lizzie: Ah! Newlyweds alone at least! What would you like to do with the rest 
of the day, sweetheart? Practice looking into my eyes and pretending that you 
love me?
Jonathan: No, I'll pass.
Lizzie: What are you doing?
Jonathan: I'm going to go look into Tammy’s eyes.
Lizzie: ( Sighs )
Beth: Rick. Rick... Rick!
Rick: Stop following me.
Beth: Okay, if you tell Mel, you are going to ruin everything.

Rick: If I don't tell her, she's going to find out anyway. It's going to take 
longer, Beth. It's going to take longer.
Beth: Okay, you know what? You are not thinking straight.

Rick: Beth, stop, stop, stop. I've called her, right? She's going to meet me 
here any minute. I would appreciate it if you're not here when she shows up.

Beth: Well, what the hell? If you're going to confess, why don't you have 
exhibit A standing right here?
Mel: Am I interrupting something?
Rick: No, we're... we're actually through.

Beth: I was just telling Rick that James still has that bug, and I need Rick 
to come back to Cedars with me right now.

Rick: And I was just telling Beth there are plenty of other doctors on duty 
that can take care of James and that my priority right now is to be with my 
wife.
Mel: It is?
Rick: Of course it is. See you later, Beth.
Beth: This isn't right, Rick!
Mel: Beth seems upset. James must be really sick.
Rick: Honey, this has nothing to do with James. It's about me.
( Jonathan yells out ) ( Tammy screams ) ( laughter )
Tammy: Tell me you climbed down here from Lizzie’s room.

Jonathan: Yeah, it's the one above this. It's not big deal. And there's no 
cameras on the fire escape.
Tammy: We like that.

Jonathan: Yeah, we like this, too. I can get used to coming down here for 
visits every night and maybe sometimes in between.

Tammy: I don't mind. Because it will take my mind off of how hard this is 
getting to take.
Jonathan: This?
Tammy: The fake marriage of you and Lizzie.
Jonathan: Well, you have to admit. We're just making it work.
Tammy: I just wish you didn't have to spread it on so thick with Lizzie.
Jonathan: Tammy, come on! You can't be jealous. It's Lizzie!

Tammy: I know you're faking it. It's just hard to see you two flirting with 
each other, especially since I know that you guys...

Jonathan: Once. And I was drunk. I was very drunk. I thought me and you were 
done. Hey, hey. Look, this is only for a couple of more months, okay? We can 
hack it. As soon as this baby is born, it's over. You know that, right?
Tammy: Yeah.

Jonathan: Okay. Baby is born, Lizzie will prove that she's a good mom, which 
she will do, and Alan will back off of her and leave the baby alone, and you and 
I will be free.
Tammy: To be together.

Jonathan: In every way. Trust me, it won't be too long before you and me are 
husband and wife.
( Phone ringing )
Dr. Baker: Steven Baker.

Altered voice: You want something you can use against Jonathan Randall? 
Something juicy? Go to the Beacon hotel, Tammy Winslow’s room. Now.

Lizzie: Get there quick, and you'll catch the guy in bed with someone who 
isn't his wife. Sorry, Jonathan. I just need you here with me tonight.
Rick: Thanks for making the time for me this afternoon to talk.

Mel: Well, actually I'm glad that you called because I wanted to talk to you 
about something, too. In fact, do you mind if I go first?

Rick: Honey, actually I need to go first because what I have to tell you is 
very important, and I just want to say it because...
Beth: Hey! Look who I found!
Rick: Leah, what are you doing here, sweetheart?
Mel: Well, I actually asked Leah to come once we had a chance to talk.

Beth: Oh, I'll let you to it and, Rick, you're right, I'll get another 
doctor. Don't worry about James.
Rick: I'm sorry. I'm a little confused. Leah is here to do...?

Mel: Well, whatever it is that we want to do. I figured, you know, we're long 
overdue to spend a day together, just the three of us, a family. And I figure 
today is the perfect day.

Rick: Well, this is certainly a change. I'm a little bit surprised. Where did 
this come from?

Mel: Well, our smart little daughter tricked me into thinking about your 
heart transplant.
Leah: I didn't trick you. I inspired you.

Mel: And she also inspired me to realize that as much as I didn't want to 
lose you then, I don't want to lose you now. So that's what I have to say. Now 
it's your turn. What is so hard for you to say?
Rick: It's nothing, honey. It can wait.
Leah: Well, it can keep then.

Rick: Yes, it can keep because right now I just want to go out and have lunch 
with my family.
Mel: Okay.
Billy: I have come up with a half dozen solutions already.
Reva: How many are legal?
Billy: Two. That's a pretty good percentage for me.
Reva: You're so good to me.
Billy: Okay, it's easy. Hey, I'm going to let you get some rest, okay?
Reva: Yeah. Billy?
Billy: Yeah?
Reva: Stay with me, please.
Billy: Yeah. Yeah. Sweetie, here. Yeah, I'm right here. Right here.
Cassie: I am so sorry I'm late, but I have an excellent excuse, I swear.
Josh: I was beginning to think that you changed your mind about meeting me.

Cassie: No, no, quite the contrary. Actually, the more I thought about it, 
the more excited I got, but I had to get the baklava, and that's the reason it 
took so long.
Josh: And this is the baklava?
Cassie: Yes, indeed. It was just made.
Josh: And you had to get it because...?

Cassie: Jeez, how soon they forget. Did you or did you not ask me to meet you 
here because this is where the Greek Festival was, which was kind of the site of 
our first date?
Josh: I did say that, yes.

Cassie: Yeah, and seeing as how this date was billed as the symbolic echo of 
that one, how could I not show up with something Greek to mark the occasion?
Josh: Hence the baklava.

Cassie: Which for the first time in as long as I have known him, Buzz was out 
of, so I had to go all the way across town to get it, but I got it. It's here, 
you're here, I'm here.
Josh: Did something happen since we talked on the phone?

Cassie: Let's just say I had a bit of a reality check. And it made me see 
that if you wanted to meet me here with your newly signed divorce papers, then
